snippet: The Broadway adaptation of “Porgy and Bess,” opening Thursday, is just one of a series of attempts by composers’ estates to get the most out their work before copyrights expire.
abstract: Broadway adaptation The Gershwins' Porgy and Bess , updated and streamlined, is just one of a series of attempts by composers’ estates to get the most out of their work before copyrights expire; newly adapted book, but not the songs, will likely gain a new copyright that could be licensed.
lead_paragraph: The Broadway adaptation of “Porgy and Bess,” opening Thursday, is just one of a series of attempts by composers’ estates to get the most out their work before copyrights expire.

headline.seo: With ‘Porgy’ on Broadway, Gershwin Heirs Flex Their Rights
headline.main: The Songs Remain the Same, but Broadway Heirs Call the Shots
